intro: Ranunculus decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and a hairy stem. Its flowers are usually solitary, with five to nine petal-like sepals that resemble true petals. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
